intro: Ononis quinata, commonly known as the five-leafed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in fine, silky hairs. Ononis quinata is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
